title: travelplanner: I need assistance in planning a week-long vacation for 2 individuals, starting from Chattanooga and covering 3 cities in Georgia. This trip will span from March 24th to March 30th, 2022, with a budget cap at $6,800. We'll be traveling with our children who are under 10 years old, hence, accommodations must be children-friendly and should ideally be entire rooms. For this trip, we would prefer not to take any flights. (3f5cb0b59f9be595)

always_included_messages.content: Based on the user's query, make the best travel plan for the user and save it. Do not ask follow-up questions.

chat_history.content:
Sure! Here is a suggested itinerary for a week-long trip to the cities of Atlanta, Savannah, and Columbus, Georgia, with a starting point of Chattanooga, tailored to your preferences and budget:

## **Day 1: Chattanooga to Atlanta** (approximately 124 miles, 2 hours 30 minutes drive)

**Attractions:**
- Atlanta Botanical Garden - Explore the beautiful gardens and discover the diverse plant life.
- World of Coca-Cola - Visit this museum dedicated to the famous soft drink brand, with interactive exhibits and tastings.
- Georgia Aquarium - One of the largest aquariums in the world, with a variety of marine life and educational programs.
- Martin Luther King, Jr. National Historical Park - Learn about the life and legacy of Martin Luther King, Jr. at this historic site.

**Dinner:**
- Saffron - A casual spot serving tea, cafe-style food, fast food, and seafood, with an average cost of $39.
- Adda - Enjoy Mexican, bakery, and tea options with an average cost of $22.
- Ahata - Indian, dessert, and tea options are available for an average of $17.

**Accommodation:**
- Unique 2BR Apartment - A child-friendly entire home/apt costing $394 per night.
- Stunning! All new near U.N. & Central Park - Another entire home/apt option with a price tag of $675 per night.
- Bright, Modern, Clean, Spacious, Brooklyn Home - A spacious home for 4 guests, priced at $1034 per night.

## **Day 2: Atlanta**

**Attractions:**
- Piedmont Park - Enjoy a leisurely walk or picnic in this urban park.
- High Museum of Art - Explore the extensive collection of American art.
- SkyView Atlanta - Take in the city views from this Ferris wheel.
- Centennial Olympic Park - Visit this park celebrating Atlanta's Olympic legacy.
- Zoo Atlanta - Get up close with animals at this zoo.

**Lunch:**
- Pizza Central - A top-rated pizzeria with an average cost of $75.
- Daawat-e-Kashmir - Another highly-rated restaurant with cafe, pizza, and American options, averaging $19.
- Baba Au Rhum - Desserts, pizza, Mexican, BBQ, and fast food are available here, with an average cost of $27.

**Dinner:**
- Beliram Degchiwala - Cafe and pizza spot with an average cost of $14.
- Radhe Shyam - Pizza and fast food restaurant with an average cost of $32.
- The Krib - Seafood, BBQ, and Italian restaurant with an average cost of $45.

## **Day 3: Atlanta to Savannah** (approximately 271 miles, 4 hours 30 minutes drive)

**Attractions:**
- Savannah Historic District - Explore the charming historic district of Savannah.
- Savannah's Waterfront - Take a stroll along the waterfront and enjoy the views.
- Forsyth Park - Relax in this beautiful park with gardens and a fountain.
- Wormsloe State Historic Site - Visit this historic site with a live oak avenue and a museum.
- Mercer-Williams House Museum - Tour this historic house museum.

**Lunch:**
- New Raj Kachori Bhandar - Tea and seafood options with an average cost of $12.
- The Mad Teapot/The Wishing Chair - Mexican, bakery, and fast food spot with an average cost of $23.
- Biryani Art - Chinese, bakery, and fast food restaurant with an average cost of $41.

**Dinner:**
- Country's Barbecue - Cafe and bakery with an average cost of $59.
- Bosphorous Turkish Cuisine - Pizza, Indian, and fast food restaurant with an average cost of $58.
- Manohar Dairy And Restaurant - Indian and fast food spot with an average cost of $23.

**Accommodation:**
- Alpha-Bet City entire floor large cool 2br -L.E.S - A child-friendly entire home/apt for $574 per night.
- Lapp House - Another entire home/apt option for $118 per night.
- Quiet Riverside Park 1 bdrm w gym - A home for 3 guests, priced at $385 per night.

## **Day 4: Savannah**

**Attractions:**
- Owens-Thomas House & Slave Quarters - Tour this historic house and learn about its history.
- American Prohibition Museum - Step back in time to the era of prohibition.
- Jepson Center & Telfair Children's Art Museum - Explore the art collections and enjoy kid-friendly activities.
- Savannah Children's Museum - Perfect for a fun-filled day with the kids.
- Tricentennial Park - Relax in this park with a playground and beautiful views.

**Lunch:**
- V S Cafe - Desserts, tea, pizza, Italian, bakery, and Chinese options with an average cost of $97.
- Pizza Day - Pizza and seafood spot with an average cost of $27.
- Hwealthcafe - Tea, bakery, cafe, American, and seafood restaurant with an average cost of $25.

**Dinner:**
- Federal Delicatessen - Tea, pizza, BBQ, and Italian with an average cost of $91.
- Vdesi - Tea, cafe, desserts, and seafood restaurant with an average cost of $81.
- Lumbini Fast Point - Seafood, BBQ, desserts, and fast food spot with an average cost of $71.

## **Day 5: Savannah to Columbus** (approximately 267 miles, 4 hours 30 minutes drive)

**Attractions:**
- Columbus Zoo and Aquarium - Explore the diverse animal exhibits.
- Topiary Park - A unique park with topiary sculptures.
- LEGOLAND Discovery Center Columbus - Perfect for a fun day out with the kids.
- Ohio Statehouse - Visit the iconic statehouse building.
- Kelton House Museum & Garden - Tour this historic house and its beautiful gardens.

**Lunch:**
- Karnataka Food Centre - French, BBQ, fast food, cafe, and Mediterranean spot with an average cost of $18.
- Yadav Ji Chholey Bhature - Pizza, Mexican, BBQ, fast food, and cafe with an average cost of $74.

**Dinner:**
- Noddy's - Tea, Mexican, BBQ, and seafood restaurant with an average cost of $93.
- Hungry Head - Pizza, French, BBQ, fast food, and cafe with an average cost of $43.
- Love Is Cakes - Desserts, pizza, Mexican, BBQ, Chinese, and seafood with an average cost of $42.

**Accommodation:**
- 31 Dec - 1 Jan lovely Prospect room - A private room for $221 per night.
- The Art Of Living - Loft apartment - An entire home/apt for $861 per night.

## **Day 6: Columbus**

**Attractions:**
- Center of Science and Industry - A science museum with interactive exhibits.
- Franklin Park Conservatory and Botanical Gardens - Explore the beautiful gardens and conservatories.
- Columbus Museum of Art - Discover the art collections from around the world.
- Zoombezi Bay - A water park for some fun water activities.
- Discovery Park - Enjoy the playgrounds and recreational activities.

**Lunch:**
- Rocomamas - Pizza, bakery, fast food, cafe, and Indian with an average cost of $21.
- Khan Tandoori Nights - Fast food and seafood with an average cost of $33.
- Cake Express - Tea, pizza, and BBQ with an average cost of $28.

**Dinner:**
- Rai Ji Caterers - Cafe, Indian, and BBQ spot with an average cost of $96.
- Sanjha Chulha - Chinese, bakery, BBQ, and Italian with an average cost of $79.
- Club Prison - Tea, seafood, fast food, and Italian with an average cost of $70.

## **Day 7: Columbus**

**Attractions:**
- Gambrinus: King of Beer - A beer-centric attraction.
- Scioto Mile Promenade - A scenic promenade along the river.
- Goodale Park - Relax in this urban park with gardens and a pond.
- Bishops Walk Fountain - A beautiful fountain in the park.
- Bicentennial Park - Enjoy the open spaces and park amenities.

**Lunch:**
- Prem Ji Delhi Wale - Chinese, American, desserts, and seafood with an average cost of $24.

**Dinner:**
- KC Bakers - Desserts, tea, pizza, Italian, and bakery with an average cost of $31.

functions.name: accommodation_search
functions.desc:
Discover accommodations in your desired city.
Example: accommodation_search("Rome") would present a list of hotel rooms in Rome.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking accommodation.

functions.name: attraction_search
functions.desc:
Find attractions in a city of your choice.
Example: attraction_search("London") would return attractions in London.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking attractions.

functions.name: city_search
functions.desc:
Find cities in a state of your choice.
Example: city_search("California") would return cities in California.

state.description: The name of the state where you're seeking cities.

functions.name: flight_search
functions.desc:
A flight information retrieval tool.
Example: flight_search("New York", "London", "2022-10-01") would fetch flights from New York to London on October 1, 2022.

departure_city.description: The city you'll be flying out from.

destination_city.description: The city you aim to reach.

date.description: The date of your travel in YYYY-MM-DD format.

functions.name: google_distance_matrix
functions.desc:
Estimate the distance, time and cost between two cities.
Example: google_distance_matrix("Paris", "Lyon", "self-driving") would provide driving distance, time and cost between Paris and Lyon.

origin.description: The departure city of your journey.

destination.description: The destination city of your journey.

functions.name: restaurant_search
functions.desc:
Explore dining options in a city of your choice.
Example: restaurant_search("Tokyo") would show a curated list of restaurants in Tokyo.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking restaurants.

functions.name: submit_day_plan
functions.desc:
Once you have collected information about the trip, call this function once for each day of the trip, starting on day 1.
If a field does not apply for a given day, use "-" to indicate this.
You MUST call this function to save the plan for each query.

current_city.description: The city for this day. If the plan is to travel between two cities, indicate it as "from A to B" (e.g. "from Ithaca to Charlotte").

transportation.description: e.g. "Flight Number: F3633413, from Ithaca to Charlotte, Departure Time: 05:38, Arrival Time: 07:46"

breakfast.description: The name of a restaurant in the city, e.g. "Nagaland's Kitchen, Charlotte"

attraction.description: Use a ";" to separate different attractions, with each attraction formatted as "Name, City". e.g. "The Charlotte Museum of History, Charlotte;"

accommodation.description: e.g. "Affordable Spacious Refurbished Room in Bushwick!, Charlotte"
